intro: Uncaria formosana, commonly known as the Formosan climbing shrub, is a species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
